amendment.description: Amendment, as modified, prohibits development assistance to countries that oppose the United States position in the United Nations General Assembly on 50 percent or more of recorded plenary votes.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 10 in the Congressional Record of May 22, to prohibit any development assistance authorized in the bill to go to any country that votes against the United States in the U.N. General Assembly more than 75% of the time.

action.text: Burton amendment (A004) modified by unanimous consent. Modification of the Burton amendment specifies that the prohibition of development assistance called for in the amendment shall not include assistance available under Chapter 1 of Part I of the Foreign Assistance Act in the case of countries which have voted in the U.N. General Assembly on less than 50% of the recorded plenary votes.
On agreeing to the Burton amendment (A004) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
